text: hi my name is I'm the head of
engineering here at any scale and we're
going to talk about two of the biggest
problems with llms and how we can fix
them problem number one is ignorance
ignorance means that the llm doesn't
know the answer to the question that
you're asking it and it tells you that
it's ignorant it doesn't know the answer
but sometimes a bigger problem is what
we call hallucination which is it
doesn't know the answer but it thinks it
knows the answer and will generate an
answer that is complete nonsense so what
we have on the left hand side here is a
stable LM before our modifications and
on the right hand side we have stable LM
after our modification and we're going
to ask them both the same question we're
going to ask them what the difference
between pack and spread in Reyes and
these are two different distribution
algorithms so that if you have actors
particular components sometimes you want
all the actors to be on one machine and
sometimes you want them to be as spread
out as possible
and so as you can see on the left hand
side it's generating nonsense about HTML
Elements which is completely wrong but
sounds very very convincing whereas on
the right hand side you can see that the
answer is pretty much spot on to find
out how we did this check out the video
below
